name: Introduction to Service Learning
description: In this experiential learning course, students apply their discipline-specific academic knowledge as they learn from, and serve, their communities. Students provide, and gain, unique perspectives and insights as they engage in placements with community partners. Through class discussions, workshops and assignments, students also develop transferable skills such as interpersonal communication, professionalism and self-reflection that help them connect theory and practice.
prerequisites: Completion of 4.0 credits and selection of a U of T Scarborough Specialist or Major program. GPA and communication skills will also be considered.
